attributes.action: Give A-Level students in the UK the same grading as with the new Scottish System
attributes.additional_details:
As an A-Level student, having incorrectly predicted grades can make the difference between attending my dream University or having my study and work prospects crushed and unable to pursue a subject at University or College.

By failing to act on this, we risk preventing many young people from continuing onto further education and achieving their full potential.
attributes.background:
A great deal of uncertainty has been created for A-Level students, given the light of the current Scottish grading scandal.

We would like for the British Government and Ofqual to provide students in England and Wales with their teachers' predicted grades instead of using a flawed algorithm.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions instead:

Review the decision to use previous data to calculate exam grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306773

Review the standardisation of grades so state school pupils aren't disadvantaged: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325422

Remove Ofqual's moderation of 2020 results based on schools previous performance: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/328957

Reverse all exam grades back to teacher’s own predictions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334491

Work with regulators and exam providers to clarify exam arrangements for 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312570
